instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.A1502: What is A1502? A1502 is a model number for a 13 inch size MacBook Pro Retina from years Mid 2014, Late 2013, Early 2015 with EMC 2875, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-3476, 820-3536, 820-4924..
definitions.ISL6259: What is ISL6259? This is a charging chip for Macbook motherboards from 2010 through 2015.
definitions.820-3476: What is 820-3476? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1502</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> missing L7430 (<SIGNAL>PPDDR_S3_REG_R</SIGNAL>)
threads.message: hello i got a <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1502</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> that was touched by  another shop. it shows green light on the magsafe but it doesn't turn on. After visual inspection, i saw that it was missing a inductor L7430 on the line <SIGNAL>PPDDR_S3_REG_R</SIGNAL>. could this missing component cause a bigger problem (i.e frying cpu)? i tried to find a donor but i wasnt able to find one with similar specs.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1502</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> missing L7430 (<SIGNAL>PPDDR_S3_REG_R</SIGNAL>)
threads.message: It should show an orange light. L7430 was removed for a reason I guess. First thing to check would be a short to GND on either side.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1502</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> missing L7430 (<SIGNAL>PPDDR_S3_REG_R</SIGNAL>)
threads.message: Sorry I meant orange light. No short on either side. My diode mode reading on both pads is about 0.128

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1502</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> missing L7430 (<SIGNAL>PPDDR_S3_REG_R</SIGNAL>)
threads.message: Should not have caused damage, put one back and go from there.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1502</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> missing L7430 (<SIGNAL>PPDDR_S3_REG_R</SIGNAL>)
threads.message: got the fan spinning and chime after replacing l7430 and <CHIP>ISL6259</CHIP>. Now i need to figure the image problem. im waiting for a new lcd

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1502</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> missing L7430 (<SIGNAL>PPDDR_S3_REG_R</SIGNAL>)
threads.message: What year is this? <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1502</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> does not tell me much, need to use the correct LCD or it will not work!

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1502</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> missing L7430 (<SIGNAL>PPDDR_S3_REG_R</SIGNAL>)
threads.message:
No Title

it's 2015 model.the board number is <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>. im pretty thee lcd connector is no good. it looks like a piece dismissing on the left side. Is it possible to change the lcd connector without replacing the entire assembly?

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1502</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> missing L7430 (<SIGNAL>PPDDR_S3_REG_R</SIGNAL>)
threads.message: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> is the 2014 model not the 2015 model. And yes you can replace just the LCD cable very easily on Retinas just have to remove spine.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1502</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> missing L7430 (<SIGNAL>PPDDR_S3_REG_R</SIGNAL>)
threads.message: [USER="1153"]JohnB8812[/USER] thanks for the clarification. I'll swap it tom and report back!

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1502</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> missing L7430 (<SIGNAL>PPDDR_S3_REG_R</SIGNAL>)
threads.message: Make sure the connector on the board is not damaged or the cable will be gone again...
